title: delaying pulse width modulation (EASY ANSWER ++)

{"title":"delaying pulse width modulation (EASY ANSWER ++)","nodes":{"0":{"type":"Notes","name":"QUESTION","x":25,"y":25,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"this is above my head. I have never used a greater than or binary gate.

Im not a prgrammer and Ive never owned a synth.

I am a chemist who found this site and love it, but can you explain trick 1 and 2 as if I were 5?

                   :D"}},"1":{"type":"Pulse","name":"PULSE","x":1580,"y":604,"ins":[["2",0],["18",0]],"inNames":["freq","pw"],"outNames":["out"],"params":{"minVal":-1,"maxVal":1}},"2":{"type":"Const","name":"Const","x":1505,"y":622,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[""],"params":{"value":110}},"3":{"type":"Delay","name":"Delay","x":319,"y":694,"ins":[["5",0],["12",0]],"inNames":["in","time"],"outNames":["out"],"params":{}},"4":{"type":"Const","name":"Const","x":47,"y":766,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[""],"params":{"value":0.5}},"5":{"type":"Tri","name":"Tri MOD","x":1375,"y":671,"ins":[["18",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":0,"maxVal":1}},"20":{"type":"Notes","name":"ANSWER","x":411,"y":26,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"OK, read the comments from left to right

Your second question is described below.

Hope it helps, 

Enjoy, 

(a or not b)"}},"21":{"type":"Notes","name":"Comment 1","x":59,"y":239,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"You want to delay (0.5 seconds) your pulse width modulation.

Here a use a TRI modulation : varying in a triangular way form 0.5 (the default value of the pulse width) to 0.85 and the delay is O.5 seconds.

important note : Delay out = 0 as long as the delay time is not over..."}},"22":{"type":"Scope","name":"Tri 0.5-0.85","x":129,"y":557,"ins":[["5",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":-0.1,"maxVal":1}},"23":{"type":"Scope","name":"Tri 0.5-0.85","x":320,"y":558,"ins":[["3",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":-0.1,"maxVal":1}},"24":{"type":"Notes","name":"Comment 2","x":499,"y":239,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"OK, the Greater node tests if the in0 value is greater than the in1 value. If it is the case, out = 1 ; else out = 0

I want to know that, because as long as the delay time is not over, it is = 0, and 0 is not greater than 0, and I want the pulse width to be 0.5. So as long a the delay time is not finished, I want to use the value 0.5."}},"25":{"type":"Scope","name":"TEST in0>in1","x":1074,"y":764,"ins":[["8",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":-0.1,"maxVal":1}},"26":{"type":"Scope","name":"NOT(TEST)","x":1070,"y":432,"ins":[["10",0]],"inNames":[""],"outNames":[],"params":{"minVal":-0.1,"maxVal":1}},"27":{"type":"Notes","name":"Comment 3","x":892,"y":223,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"So, i use the Add node to take the 0 value of the delay (as long as the delay time is not over) and add 0.5, so that 
0 + 0.5 = 0.5 :)
To use this 0.5, I have to multiply it by 1 (the binary gate) as long as in0 = 0 is NOT GRATER than in1 = 0 , so as long 1-greater TEST = 1. But When the delay time is over, Greater Test=1 (& NOT(TEST)=0) and I use directly the delayedModvalue."}},"28":{"type":"Notes","name":"Comment 4","x":1316,"y":220,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"The ADD node adds 0.5 + 0 = 0.5 as long as the delay time is not finished

and 

adds 0 + modvalue = modvalue, when the delay time is over."}},"29":{"type":"Notes","name":"THANKS","x":108,"y":949,"ins":[],"inNames":[],"outNames":[],"params":{"text":"how would this all work with notes triggered by a
